value: the Mandela effect who's heard of this
thing the weird and wacky world of the
internet brings you the Mandela affect
the Mandela effect is named for Nelson
Mandela because there's tons of people
out there who upon hearing of the death
of Mandela in 2013 said to themselves
what he's already dead I had this happen
to me with Jack Palance so I know
exactly what they're talking about but
nothing ever happened when it happened
to me with Jack plants but this time
Nelson Mandela a whole cavalcade a whole
avalanche of people came forward saying
nanana Nana Mandela already dead I know
this because I remember XYZ I remember
where I was I remember who I turned to
and said oh that's sad i remember seeing
the faces of the people at the funeral
yada yada people remember this there's
no denying that whatever the truth is
these people remember this I could bring
up a whole conversation about memory but
that's not where I'm going where I'm
going is why is this such a cultural
phenomenon why has this captured the
imagination now in history where I'm
sure the same sort of thing has happened
forever just like it did with me with
Jack Palance people are coming forward
this whole Mandela effect thing is like
a snowball rolling downhill there's all
kinds of new things almost everyday
stuff from the Bible that allegedly has
changed stuff from very very famous big
movies that are Forrest Gump and field
of dreams and I think even the wizard of
oz I don't know I can't keep up with it
some of them resonate with me some of
them don't whether or not some entity is
going back through the past and changing
movie lines and Bible verses and then
destroying all evidence to the contrary
all evidence of the original so that it
frustrates the Dickens out of everyone
looking for it whether that's happening
or not I don't know whether being
brainwashed somehow to have false
memories put into our heads I'd
no I don't know what this is all about
but what I do know is that the
underlying angst is universal and that
is that we don't really have a good
handle on the past and we can't hundred
percent ever prove what's in our
memories that's frustrating and it's
been frustrating forever I'll bet not a
vampire so I've only lived like a normal
lifespan so when I say forever I'm
guessing george orwell wrote in 1984
that he who controls the past controls
the future and some other great famous
person I can't remember who and I didn't
google it said that he who forgets
history is doomed to repeat it so to us
it's very very important to have an
accurate hold on the past so that you
know we can proceed accordingly we can
proceed with full knowledge of the truth
but I posit that we never have had that
and with the digital age upon us it's
just going to get worse I think it
scares us and it scares me frankly to
think about these things because I
recall learning about the Dark Ages know
when we supposedly went backwards
instead of forwards there wasn't
progress there was the opposite and I
see the evidence in the fall of the
Roman Empire they had plumbing and then
for hundreds of years we didn't have
plumbing I know about the burning of the
library at Alexandria when all that
knowledge was gone I see the Vatican
hoarding information and I know that
there's classified documents all over
the place I also know that there's
different versions of the same story in
today's newspapers I could probably find
examples online right now published
simultaneously so it's very
destabilizing and the Mandela effect
kind of brings all of that under one fun
little almost game like
scenario for me it's made me really
think about this pursuit of the truth
that I'm so dedicated to because I'm
never going to get it this just makes it
obvious if I didn't already get it the
universe is up there shaking its head at
me saying yes you hear all those
examples of history that you just said
yourself that was me trying to tell you
guys to stop being so addicted to
information and go instead for wisdom
information who cares information flows
past you like the water in a river
you're standing at the bank and you're
looking at it and it's never going to be
the same again it's gone it's changed
shape it's moved along it's reformatted
itself all you can do is go from that
place to the next place having seen the
river when you saw it way off on a
tangent about rivers now but perhaps you
see what I'm saying there's not much we
can control there's not much we can know
for sure not saying to ignore facts or
history but we can't put as much weight
on them we can't rely on this thing
called information to uphold wisdoms as
if it's going to be there for us to go
check on know we have to become it as
much as we can in our short lifetimes
and from that point go forward and build
a better world George Orwell is right he
who controls the past controls the
future but only in our current paradigm
where we're all addicted to information
where we're all freaked out when our
memories don't match the evidence that's
never going to stop and so instead of
letting this whole thing destabilize you
if instead of letting it pass by you
unobserved think about the difference
between information
knowledge and wisdom who knows maybe
next year Nelson Mandela will die again
peace and love as always
